Reviews.Title: “Everything you need”
Reviews.Author: amar k Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights for a stag do. There were 4 of us in the quad room which was very large and easily accommodated us. The room was very clean and the bathroom was very clean too. The hotel is an excellent location not too far from Leidspeilen (walking distance) and a short cab or tram ride away from dam square. Would highly recommend this hotel. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Von7_11
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for its location which is near to the musuems and easy walking through Vondel Park to the city centre.The hotel is clean and basic but the staff are friendly and the beds are comfortable with nice linen.We didn't have breakfast but there are coffee shops nearby and a very good bagel shop just up the road.For value it would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “im staying here for 2 months”
Reviews.Author: hsrajoe
Reviews.Content: I came to Blyss before with my parents and enjoyed alot. excelent location. amazingly helpfull staff. specialy Nick. helped with reservations at clubs and restraunts as well as museums and tours. Im staying here and have read some of the reviews. im stying in room 15 on the garden floor and yes the windows r small but its a well decorated room with my own shower and toilet and a flat screen tv. for a three star hotel i think this is a hell of alot better then the other hotels ive seen in this city. I am only writing this as i truely do feel bad for the hotel and the people running it with such bad reviews. lad birds in december and people who didnt even stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: mollymak
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 day stay in this hotel. Well it's not bad at all , clean & tidy & the decor is very modern , it looks like they are doing the place up bit by bit & for what we paid I'd defiantly recommend. It's in a ideal location a short walk to the Leidisplien & a short Tram into Dam Centre. We didn't have Breakfast at the Hotel, but I can say that they where very helpful at reception, even allowing 4 off our party of 8 check in early so we all had somewhere to freshen up. I would certainly return here & we where all happy with the hotel , it's location & the staff.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Idan M
Reviews.Content: The rooms are okay (we took the quad room) compare to 3 stars hotels (why u need more than that while you staying in Amsterdam?!), the staff are pretty amazing, the rooms are clean and the location.. oh.. the location, about like 2 min walk to the leidsiplen, (where all the parties, bars, coffeeshops) 7 min Tram to the Dam Square....

Reviews.Title: “Great Pictures - Terrible Rooms! Grubby Bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Dhlix
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled by the pictures! The best part of this hotel is the foyer and thats it. We booked a double room and were first given a room that smelt damp and had two single bedsa pushed together. I had to go to reception and request that it be changed - after which we were shown another room Double Bed - single quilts - no amount of asking could get us a new quilt. The window was propped up by a wooden block, rooms were cold and smelt of damp. AVOID. Definitely now worth the money we paid - you have been warned PS Nice things? Lady @ reception and location!

Reviews.Title: “dirty, ugly, expensive”
Reviews.Author: vale_parma
Reviews.Content: the location is the only good thing. Breakfast is laughable, rooms are dirty and cold, hotel is very old, people not nice, price very high.. All is negative!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: turnfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 4-6 October. The website gave an excellent impression of the hotel but the reality was somewhat different. Pleasant reception and staircase leading to hostel style corridors and rooms. Once in the room the walls were grubby, everything looked very tatty and the bathroom could be described as basic at best. There was significant noise all night from other rooms which was resolved once I'd managed to get hold of the night porter at 04:00 after 15 mins of calling reception. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever but most expensive.......rip off......”
Reviews.Author: ema340x
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed her from 23/9 - 25/9 2011 for 2 nights. The hotel on the website looks fab, we couldnt wait to arrive and get settled into our room. The hotel lobby was lovely with a big chandelier and loud wallpaper........but our hotel room was discraceful. We were put in the cellar with a small bathroom which was dark, dull and miserable. We could here everything as the windows were on the outside path level. We paid over 400euros for the 2 nights. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. The location however is great....just 5 mins walk to next town and then another 5mins walk to dam square......Ann Frank museum is a must, very emotional but well worth the money

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lestroismages
Reviews.Content: Visited for a 2 night weekend break during the music and drama festival. Torrential rain throughout and the hotel drainage system seemed to have problems coping..nasty niffs around the entrance hall and basement rooms, but staff moved us to a bigger room for no extra charge and were extremely apologetic. Rooms were very nicely decorated. Free access to computer to check e mails much appreciated and within a nice distance of all the main sites. Would book again and hope for better weather!

Reviews.Title: “BLYSSLESS”
Reviews.Author: katya b
Reviews.Content: ...i could not wait to leave out of here to write the review....The pictures of the website are VERY misleading.The hotel is called a boutique hotel and its so not a boutique, its antuque and not in a good sense. The rooms look nothing like the reception area. I stayed 3 nights and the sheets have not been changed once..i know because i had dropped some make up on the first day and i am still here with the same sheets. This makes me wonder if the sheets have been changed prior to my arrival. The curtains have probably not been washed for years because they have brown stains on them....i wish i could post real pictures of the rooms ... oh i think i can and i will. When i asked for conditioner for the hair...i was told to use the shower gel ... "that is conditioner" i was told...as though i cant read. The tv was probably from 1970 and so small with volume that i could only hear if was very very close to it...but ok i'll let that slide cuz i wasnt watching tv in amsterdam; however........ I believe these are the basics of a good running hotel. Not worth the amount paid at all. The only good thing about it..is the staff are very friendly and very nice. I guess they have to compensate for the rest of the travesty. I understand everyone needs to work and make money, and if you want to be a hotel owner, then charge the right price and dont mislead people. Some people maybe ok with this kind of a hotel for a right price of no more than a 30 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “we really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: johnny_shaw
Reviews.Content: the staff were really helpful, polite and welcoming, wish i had booked a longer stay, the rooms are to a good standard, everything you need is a short walk away, and its fairly quiet, i would recommend a stay here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “what you pay is what you get”
Reviews.Author: emy77emy
Reviews.Content: So, we've spent 4 days here. Location - Quiet area, 1 tram station from Leidseplein, 5 from Centraal Station; supermarket nearby; 5 min walk to Leidseplein, 10 min walk to shopping area, 15-20 to Dam Square, 25 to RLD, 10 min to Heineken Experience Room 017 - 4 beds room, ground floor - accesibility to inner garden, really spacious, bathtube & shower in the bathroom; plasma screen Breakfast - normal, enough to start the day Staff - great, really helpful & kind

Reviews.Title: “No blyss”
Reviews.Author: KeithN16
Reviews.Content: My room was like Anne Frank's hidy hole whereas my friend had the nun's cell in the attic. Looks OK on the outside but is overpriced crap. There were holes in the bed clothes and other horrors.

Reviews.Title: “i have been in hostels better”
Reviews.Author: Nic_85_26
Reviews.Content: Well the check in and out was very slow i dont know whether this is the system they use or just very slow staff. The website and reception is very misleading as it looks very plush until you get into the room. The lift did not reach our floor, was room 207. The room was so small it had 2 single beds which is fine but they must have been child size beds. Only 1 towel which was very small was provided. We had building works that was going on from 8am which is what you don't want!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: -Miki-001
Reviews.Content: Reception: friendly staff, English spoken (no Dutch??). Check out time was extended to 12.00 with no extra cost! Rooms: no elevator to 3rd floor, rooms are spacious but the furniture is rather basic. Beds are comfortable. Only one towel per guest was supplied. Bathroom: the shower curtain was too short, so the water just ran in the bathroom, wet feet guaranteed! Orientation: very good! close to the Museumplein, Vondepark en Leidsplein, well connected w/ Public Transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Could really do better!”
Reviews.Author: Jasperco
Reviews.Content: The Blyss Hotel is well-situated for travellers to Amsterdam with tram and bus routes close by. It consists of couple of refurbished old houses, with the decor now more or less modern. The welcome is a friendly one, though staff could have told us there and then that breakfast and city taxes were not included in the rate we had paid: waiting till checkout to do this is rather annoying. The rooms are quite small and fairly sparsely furnished, though the bath/shower rooms and toliets are modern and clean. Only one rather thin small towel was provided for each guest. My room had no reading light, simply a dim ceiling one. Breakfast, continental in type, was marred by there being no way to toast bread and cold boiled eggs. Just a little attention to detail could improve this friendly place no end!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: smittieswife
Reviews.Content: The reception certainly gives you an impression the rooms don't fully live up to. The room was standard and very basic with no frills but we were just looking for somewhere comfortable to sleep. The bathroom could have been cleaner, I must say that our shower pipe burst and it was replaced the next morning, prompt service. There was some noise through the night with other guests yelling but it didn't last long. If all your looking for is a base to put your head down after sightseeing then not a bad place to book.

Reviews.Title: “Give Blyss a miss!”
Reviews.Author: dondon180
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by a receptionist who was completed wasted, and he told is so on many occassions.... in hindsight I wish I was too, as that's the only way you can enjoy this hotel.... We got moved from our first room as the lights didn't work.... Only to discover the next day that there was no hot water anywhere in hotel. Manager was quite rude when we asked to leave a day early, and made out he was doing us a big favour by not charging us for the extra night!....if you want basic comodities like hot Water and lights that work, then stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sonuraj99
Reviews.Content: This is nice hotel,professional service,very helpful staff,they have nice restaurant. IT servs good indian food as well. Convinient if you are visit convention centre. Very convinient for bus stop,market and tram stations. It is good location if you are vising amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: annette024
Reviews.Content: Just back from Amsterdam where I had a ball. Before going I saw bad reviews on Trip Advisor which I now see as being extremely unfair. The hotel was in a perfect location, was clean and staff were lovely so don't believe all you see.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: Olgakazak
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with Amsterdam during my short trip May 27-30! and want to say â€œMany Thanks!â€� to Blyss' helpful staff who was always nice and polite, brought additional blankets and even turn on heating for us (this May was really cold) and advised a perfect restaurant for dinner. The hotel is perfectly located near Vondelpark, Museums and Leidesplein. I could easily walk around all the city attractions. I am totally fascinated by Amsterdam and truly Blyss hotel made a very good impression on me. Looking forward to coming back next year and find myself in a cosy Blyss room) [--]

Reviews.Title: “Definately not Bliss!!”
Reviews.Author: sickofnosun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while stranded in Amsterdam due to Volcano. The price for a deluxe room was 95 euro. The room was basic and had a leaking basin, cracked tiles and no toileteries except shower soap! Definately not deluxe standard!! The following night the price increased to 150 euro, a real rip off. The location was fine with nearby shops, bars and park. I was surprised that this hotel had 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “really really bad!”
Reviews.Author: chemicalbrothers
Reviews.Content: The service was really bad. No reception at night (no 24/24h service as mentionned!). The room was terrible, situated in the basement, poorly isolated, very noisy, not clean and toilet was leaking! They refused to change us the room and didn't offer any reduction, and we paid 90 euros!!! ...and this is not a family hotel, but a business managed from abroad and run by under-paid asian staff! I do NOT recommand this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: Dirk_18
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a four person room when visiting Amsterdam with friends. Booked fairly late so wasn't expecting much, especially having read some trip advisor review but was pleasantly surprised. The rooms where clean and of a good standard (our 4 bed room was massive) with very comfy beds. A good location not far from bars, restaurants and tram stops. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfy and clean hotel for a short stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Worst. Hotel. EVER. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE.”
Reviews.Author: Stevie_D1988
Reviews.Content: Absolutely shocking hotel, the staff aren't friendly, the rooms are disgusting and shoddy, poorly maintained and terrible value for money. When we arrived the receptionist demanded either credit card details or if you didn't have a card, â‚¬50 upfront to accost for any 'extra charges' that you may mysteriously incur. With my wallet â‚¬50 lighter, I arrived to a FREEZING COLD hotel room with windows that didn't or wouldn't stay open, with an overhead light that buzzed on and off at will and two bedside lamps that just didn't work. Was promised a flat screen LCD TV with 20+ English speaking channels. The TV was small, boxy and had 1 English channel which was a science documentary channel. Exciting... We could hear EVERYTHING that our neighbors were saying and the thundering of footsteps above us as the ceiling shook. On the second day we awoke to the gentle pitter patter of CONSTRUCTION WORK about three feet from our window as Dutch builders laughed, played music and engaged grinders and drills at 7AM!!! Staff were rude and nosy. (I had one cleaner stop what he was doing to come over and LISTEN to a conversation I was having with my friend, I actually had to tell him to go away!!!) The bathrooms were small, smelly and poorly maintained with facecloths for towels and shoddy lighting. Unless you're dying to find out what a bad hotel really is, get a sleeping bag and a pillow and sleep in the street, as you'll probably be better treated and a lot warmer than this dive of a hotel. AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jess_in_Ks
Reviews.Content: The staff was very rude and the policies seemed shady. I was there with a group and my room was decent, but my friend's room was atrocious, disgusting, and noisy. They were able to switch rooms and the 2nd one was a big improvement. The rooms were extremely small, the walls were thin, and housekeeping was a joke. My bed had hair on it from the previous person that stayed in my room, I was extremely grossed out and ended up sleeping on top of my sweaters. This hotel is good if you need a place to pass out or you're in a bind, but not for quality or cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Blyss faÃ§ade! Not all that glitters is gold - avoid!”
Reviews.Author: chasing_sunflowers
Reviews.Content: Lesson learned. Always consult tripadvisor before booking. I booked directly with the hotel and they charged my debit card twice (2 weeks before my wedding!). I was not happy at all - and it took them 12 days to refund. Not great. The lobby is well presented, but unfortunately that is it. My wedding party traveled here and my best friend was put in the basement. It was appauling! Damp, dirty and generally smelled of mold. She has asthma and asked to be moved to another room. It wasn't much better. The showers were gross - in fact my friends took hand sanitizer and cleaned the shower. I wore my flipflop. Seriously, it was pretty gross. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone - just stay in the cheapest hostel you can find - honestly, it will be cheaper and probably cleaner (eek!). The front desk staff were very nice though and generally helpful despite the horrible rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: dinomike20
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, staff were extremely helpful on where to find things and went out of their way to assist in organising our activities. Not the most central location, but tram just around the corner, and easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: SKTT09
Reviews.Content: Poor quality rooms, dirty shower, broken toilet, no space whatsoever for the luggage in their "quad" room, plus it is on the 3rd floor and the lift only goes up to a stop between the 1st and the 2nd floors! No help with luggage either (it wasn't a trivial task carrying it up 1.5 floors as we were traveling with 2 kids). On the positive side, the staff were nice, but this does not compensate for all the shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel "Blyss", (newly called) has a nice hall entry, but the rooms are awefull!”
Reviews.Author: Titwan
Reviews.Content: As I was alone for business trip. They gave me (as usual) the domestic room under the roof. -> Window was blocked by the dirty white fresh painting, -> No electricity plugs available in the room, except the razor plug in the bathroom. Not obvious to use the laptop. I move a bit a dressing cupboard from the wall to reach an hypothetical electricity plug, and I observe no security plug but a simple domino to connect the lamp on the tiny table. That ELECTRICAL domino was DIRECTLY IN CONTACT with the WOOD of the cupboard. I thought, it was a bad luck, I obtained the lack ugly, so ... I immediately asked to change the room. The young personal is really friendly and at your service. And gently and carefully, they gave me one of the best room they could give me: A twin-bed room. But the standard was not better than in the monk room. Lights were capricious, sink was dislocked, wall painting are used. The Bed was OK, The Hot Water was OK, The Cupboard was OK, It is OK for 1 or 2 small budget nights. But the hotel need a serious fresh mark up. - Paintings - Electricity - Plumber (Sanitar) ... The breakfast service was cheap 7,5 â‚¬ and unlimited. But it is not gastronomical Break fast. - Orange Juice - Tea Coffee Milk - Corn Flakes, Muesli - Toast, Jam and Butter - Egg, Dutch Ham, Gouda, - Dutch Bred

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: siobhanc
Reviews.Content: there was renavations during our stay and the place was relly dusty. the brekfast was like wood shavens, the room was quite large but poorly decorated, the bathroom was small and unclean. the staff spoke very little english, and just walked into your room without knocking.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel i ever stayed for my business trip”
Reviews.Author: adamopteron
Reviews.Content: The only place that is clean and looks good is the lobby. The room is dirty and you can hear conversation/noise from your neighbouring rooms. The worse 3 star hotel that I ever stayed. Donâ€™t be full by the lobby picture. The room is small and dirty, i stayed in better hostel then this hotel guest room during my student time. stay away from this hotel. Blyss Hotel / Groenhof Hotel are the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: hearty100
Reviews.Content: We booked the suite with garden view for a short 3 night break, it was very clean and newly decorated if in a slightly sombre style, jacuzzi bath was lovely and hot water supply excellent. Garden was a building site but didnt bother us as weather was cold anyway. It would have been nice to have tea and coffee making facilities in room instead of having to purchase from the bar at 5 euros for 2 small cups of tea The tv had numerous english channels which we watched while getting ready to go out etc Didnt bother with breakfast as looked a ramshackle affair and we were never up early enough Towels were sparse and if you didnt vacate your room by 10 am each day it didnt get cleaned All in all reasonable value for money and in a good location Staff were not that welcoming and probably wouldnt stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very poor accomodation and nothing worked.”
Reviews.Author: TM24
Reviews.Content: Booked two family rooms well in advance. These were not available on arrival. Given a 4 bedded room with another bed crammed in and a single. This did not work as we were two families. In the single room the shower and cold tap did not work. Breakast was very basic and poor value for money. Lobby was an opulent facade to the chaos beyond. Very expensive for what we got.Staff very friendly. Never want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Won't recommend this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: FunkyTravel4
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 3-night amsterdam trip, and will say that the only negative thing about this short vacation was the Groenhof Hotel. First of all, it is not right in the city center, which becomes boring after 1 day. I've seen many small hotels in the city center that would have made much more comfortable to go back. Second thing, I taught that to be classified as a 3 star hotel you would need an elevator... Rooms are clean, but don't look under your bed. Furniture is old, very very basic and a poor look. The are constructions going on at the hotel, which is not the best thing to find. One of the worst things was breakfast... if you could call it so !!! Poor choice, poor quality and not that clean either. Staff was not nice, not bad either. It took them 2 days to get a second keycard done and on the second day they delivered the wrong towels in the room. I know one should not expect a lot from a 140 euro triple room in amsterdam, but we probably would have found a much nicer place in the city center for the same cost. Wouldn't go back for any reason !!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be returning to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: rebel75
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, a short walk to Vondelpark (great little cafe called 'Small Talk' just around the corner from Van Gogh museum) & Leidseplein, in a safe area and close to the trams. Contrary to previous reviews we found the staff quite helpful (on arrival our bags were carried up the steep stairs!). I can't recommend the hotel for the following reasons... the first room we stayed in was not clean, walls need to be painted (also true of second room we stayed in), the shower did not work properly, no hand towels during the entire stay, bed linen was clean but old and worn, no lift, breakfast very poor standard and overcrowded seating arrangements, overpriced and not good value for money. Despite best efforts of the hardworking staff I don't believe this hotel deserves 3 star status. We have stayed in many 3 star hotels and guesthouses throughout Europe (including Amsterdam) that are of a much higher standard than this.

Reviews.Title: “Water running down the walls!”
Reviews.Author: loumcg83
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights, room was quite clean but on the ceiling were alot of damp patches and when the people in the room above had a shower/used toilet, we could here the water dripping ontop of our ceiling. woke on the last morning to find ALOT of water running down the walls ontop of us! Only plus was it was the last morning! When we told the receptionist he sent someone up to take a look and his response was, ok ill fix the problem later! breakfast was bad, you couldnt even have toast n bread was stale. stairs were v.steep and staff were not to helpful in giving directions. would not stay here again, definately not a three star, the worst hotel ive stayed in. On a good note it is walking distance to all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JeffDJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is run by chislers. The hotel has a 72-hour cancellation policy. We had to change our arrival date, but the hotel's phone number on the reservation system used by travel agents, which we had on our itinerary, was wrong. We spent a day calling the wrong number. Finally, after tracking down the correct number, we reached the hotel, but then it was only 48 hours before we arrived. They charged us for the night and refused to remove the charge notwithstanding a letter from our travel agent. The rooms are small and without any charm. Even though the hotel offers a free breakfast, we went out everyday after the first because it was not good. The staff was friendly, but not well informed. When we asked for a recommendation for an Indonesian restaurant (which are plentiful in Amsterdam), the desk clerk said she did not know of any and instead tried to steer us to an Indian restaurant (owned by a relative of the hotel owner). We found an Indonesian restaurant a few blocks from the hotel. We asked the desk to call us a cab when we checked out. On the way to the airport, we learned from the cab driver that his uncle owned the hotel. In Amsterdam, taxis have three different rates. Not surprisingly, we were charged the highest rate.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights at the Groenhof”
Reviews.Author: BlueTattoo
Reviews.Content: I am surprised at the reviews this hotel has received. My friends and I have just returned from the Groenhof and I found it to be a very pleasant hotel. My husband and I have been to Amsterdam a number of times before and normally stay in 2 star hotels, as we prefer not to fork out a fortune for somewhere you won't spend much time. The differences between the previous hotels and this one were clear. There were six of us in the group spread over 3 triple rooms. Our room was a good size, with lots of storage space and a really comfy bed (although, as they were 2 singles pushed together, there were some 'falling through the gap' incidents!). Breakfast was great, offering breads, jams, cereals, ham, cheese, eggs, fruit juice and coffee. I've found in 2 stars that they frequently only offer the bread and jam options, so was happy with this. The stairs are steep and, if you're on the 3rd floor, you will receive a workout! The hotel might be slightly far out for some, but it's a nice walk to Leidseplein (approx 10 mins) so we were happy. Very close to Vondelpark, which was a plus. The only negative was that the cleaners obviously objected to cleaning hair from the shower drain but that was really trivial...I think the Americans who've rated it badly need to remember that Europeans rate their facilities differently to America. Compared to 3 star hotels we've been to in New York or Las Vegas, this place isn't in the same league...put in perspective though, it's a nice hotel and not too expensive in comparison to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: swedeheart68
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Groenhof was brief, thankfully, only one night. We found the staff to be sometimes rude, as well as shabby conditions. Watch the pipes in the shower, as they get VERY hot- I burned my hand. We were really hungry when we arrived, there is no restaurant but that was no big deal. The lady at the desk called Domino's for us, but it was unbelieveable when we were told that we had to take it down in the basement breakfast room to eat it, since no food was allowed in the rooms! What??? I am disabled with 2 small children. Carrying pizzas down the narrow and steep stairs was ridiculous. I went step by step down on my bum, which made it a little easier. Climbing back up with weak legs was just as easy as climbing Everest. We were shorted one pillow, so we called the front desk. "Sorry, you should have called us earlier, the linen people are gone for the day" we were told. This was 8pm! We folded up a blanket for a pillow, and about 2 hrs later, the lady came with a pillow from another room. I will say that the pillows were VERY comfy and so were the beds, and the only friendly "staff member" I met was the cat from next door who liked to come in the lobby occasionally and receive scratches from the guests. Oh, be sure to be quiet in the lobby, I was SHUSHED by the desk lady for speaking too loudly to my children. Very, very disappointing time at the Groenhof.

Reviews.Title: “What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel, and got exactly what I expected. The cost of a single room was relatively cheap in comparison to the other hotels I found. Upon arriving the staff were eager and friendly to help me. They gave me amap, and gave good advice for places to go and eat and drink, and fun things to see. The location was excellent, a five minute walk to the Van Gogh museum. If your looking for a 4 or 5 star hotel then don't go there, but if you want a good clean hotel, which isn't too expensive with nice staff then I highly recommend this hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay very much. The hotel was just perfect. Very close to the leidse plein and museums. The rooms were clean and the staff was really friendly. They even spoke french. I would recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This isn't the best hotel in the world, but that is reflected in the price. Its relatively clean the beds are comfortable. The bathroom was an adaquate size. I personally would stay here again, if it wasn't so far from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DonPaulo
Reviews.Content: Rude, unhelpful staff. Cheap breakfast of low quality. Rooms poorly ventilated and more like a hospital. Surprise charges on departure. Broken promises.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisfromKos
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we had friends waiting for us and so dropped off our bags and went out. The initial review of the room was that it was a bit shabby, but we were only staying 3 nights and it was already late, so we would make do. When we returned to the room, we were able to take a better account of the situation. Why hang white curtains when you obviously have no intention of ever washing them? They were filthy. Again, only 3 nights, be patient. Bathroom facilities? What a joke! The shower stall was a tile lower than the rest of the bathroom and the shower curtain was black with mold! Also, there was no heat in the bathroom. The icing on the cake however was when I opened the wardrobe to hang my coat and the most offensive smell emerged. The extra blanket was just thrown in the top half and I have a suspicion that is where the smell came from. I was not brave enough to have a closer inspection, however. I barely slept awaiting for the morning to leave. We skipped breakfast at the hotel figuring if the rooms were filthy, what was breakfast going to be like? When we tried to check out, the gentleman at reception insisted that we pay for 2 nights even though we only stayed 1 and we explained our reasons for leaving. He insisted that this was the standard for a 3 star hotel in Amsterdam. I told him that this was not the standard for a 3 star hotel for anywhere! After a lengthy "discussion" I paid cash for 1 night and he insisted that he would take the other night from my credit card. We walked out and found a much better hotel just further up the block. I have never been so disgusted and disappointed with a hotel before. After having been in the travel business for the past 12 years, I can definitely say that this hotel is well below par and I would not be able to recommend it to anyone! Take my advice, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: GCARLO57
Reviews.Content: I spent one night only, fortunately, in this hotel.Upon arrival we had to pay cash before entering the room, theN we found on one bed , dirty linen that had to be changed. The room lacked maintenance on the furniture and in the bathrrom nothing was repared. In the morning breakfast was very poor and when i asked for chocolate for my child they did not have any. And to finish we asked to leave the luggage for the day and it was kept outside in a courtyard getting wet because of the rain. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in a Quad Room. There was plenty of room, it was nice and clean. When we asked for extra pillows and hangers they were delivered immediately. The staff were great, helpful and no query was too big or small. Harry, is a mine of information, always cheerful and willing to help. It is local to 'Liedesplein' (about 4minute walk), museums, markets, ideally situated. One tiny suggestion is tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. Reception is closed at 11:00pm, so if you return to the hotel later, you are not able to get a hot drink. That being said... ...We shall definitely be going back.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Blyss
HotelInfo.Address: Vondelstraat 74-78, Amsterdam 1054 GN, The Netherlands
